fields.name: Poully-Fuisse
fields.notes: A delightful white wine that showcases the best of Burgundy's Chardonnay grape. With a pale golden hue, this wine has a captivating aroma of fresh red apples, honey, and white flowers that immediately captures the senses. On the palate, it offers an exquisite taste with elegant and rich flavors of toasted nuts and citrus that provide a perfect balance of acidity and minerality. This wine is a true representation of the region's terroir, where the limestone soil and cool climate provide ideal growing conditions for Chardonnay grapes. This wine is an excellent choice to pair with a variety of foods. Its rich flavors and balanced acidity complement roasted salmon, shellfish, and creamy cheeses exceptionally well. It also pairs nicely with lighter dishes, such as grilled vegetables or chicken, making it a versatile option for any meal.

fields.name: Meiomi Pinot Noir
fields.notes:
Meiomi Pinot Noir Red Wine brings you structure and depth seldom seen in a pinot noir wine, thanks to its unique and meticulous aging process. Aged for six months in French oak barrels, this California red wine's juicy strawberry flavor and notes of dark berries and toasted mocha add complexity and depth on the palate. With a rich garnet color and a ruby edge, this pinot noir wine permeates aromas of bright fruit jam, mocha and oak.

This California wine owes much of its complexity to its varied upbringing, featuring grapes harvested from Monterey, Santa Barbara and Sonoma. The silky texture and balanced acidity of this Meiomi wine make it a perfect table top companion for dark chocolate or thin crust pizza.

fields.name: Silver Oak
fields.notes: Maroon in color with a garnet hue, this wine has an enticing nose of maraschino cherries, blackberry bramble, and brisket with notes of clove and star anise. It’s mouthwatering with a juicy entry and has a fruity mid-palate of currant with toasted vanilla and roasted brown sugar character from American oak barrels. Structured tannins provide an elegant character with a long and expressive finish.

fields.name: Château Margaux
fields.notes: This is a serious Margaux, hugely Cabernet dominant on both nose and palate as you would expect with 94% of the blend. It has an extremely fine, elongated tannic structure, barely perceptible yet classy, with a focus on gentle elasticity. There are more blue than black fruits here, wonderfully spun out and softened with crushed tobacco. It has the expansive aromatic structure of Margaux, the floral and mineral aspects clear, as is the tension that lifts the palate up and out. It's reminiscent of 2005, though with less evident tannins. It's not as hefty as the 2010 or as staggering as the 2015, but it is still a joyful expression of the estate. 1% Petit Verdot completes the blend.

fields.name: Cloudy Bay
fields.notes: It's fresh and crisp with notes of honeydew, passionfruit, and lemongrass. Perfect for seafood, roast turkey and stuffing.

fields.name: Penfold Cabernet Bin 707
fields.notes: Deep crimson. Fresh elderberry, cassis and herb garden aromas with aniseed/ liquorice notes. Rich fruit-sweet wine with ample cassis, elderberry and boysenberry fruits, fine chocolaty tannins and mocha oak complexity. A beautifully balanced and youthful wine with elegance and power. Substantial yet classical with the richness, volume and vinosity for long-term aging.

fields.name: Antinori Tignanello
fields.notes: A supple, elegant red highlighted by bright cherry, black currant, violet, tobacco, iron and oak spice aromas and flavors. Though fluid and seemingly approachable now, this is well-structured and shows the balance to age

fields.name: Roero Arneis
fields.notes: Straw yellow color, with greenish reflections. The bouquet is intense with floral aroma, like Acacia flowers, and peach and lemon notes. On the palate, the flavor is fresh corresponding to the fruity and floral notes.

fields.name: Gulp Hablo
fields.notes: Straw yellow color, with greenish reflections. The bouquet is intense with floral aroma, like Acacia flowers, and peach and lemon notes. On the palate, the flavor is fresh corresponding to the fruity and floral notes.

fields.name: Dom Pérignon Blanc
fields.notes:
On the nose, aromas of almond and powdered cocoa develop gradually into
white fruit with hints of dried flowers. Classic toasted notes give a rounded finish
and denote a fully realized maturity. On the palate, the wine instantly traces an astoundingly fine line between
density and weightlessness. Its precision is extreme, tactile, dark and chiselled.
The full taste lingers with the utmost elegance on a sappy, spicy note.

fields.name: Sancerre Le Reine Blanche
fields.notes: The nose presents intense aromas of flintstone, citrus, white peach, and linden flowers, creating a vibrant and aromatic profile. On the palate, the wine is rich and fresh, with mineral notes and citrus fruit flavors. It offers a long, clean finish, showcasing its balance and purity. The wine is medium-bodied with good acidity, providing a crisp and refreshing mouthfeel. This Sancerre pairs beautifully with seafood dishes, particularly oysters and shellfish, as well as goat cheeses like Crottin de Chavignol. Its crisp acidity and mineral character also complement light poultry dishes and fresh salads.
